thread.title: SDSU picked to win Mountain West; Lobos selected sixth with Williams tabbed top Newcomer
thread.title_full: SDSU picked to win Mountain West; Lobos selected sixth with Williams tabbed top Newcomer | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Geoff Grammer / Journal Staff Writer
title: SDSU picked to win Mountain West; Lobos selected sixth with Williams tabbed top Newcomer
text:
The San Diego State Aztecs, who have shared or won outright four of the last five Mountain West men’s basketball titles, have been selected in the league’s preseason media poll to win it again for the 2015-16 season.
The University of New Mexico Lobos, entering their third season under head coach Craig Neal, were voted sixth in the preseason media voting and junior forward Tim Williams, who practiced with the team last season but did not play after transferring from Samford, was voted the league’s Newcomer of the Year.
The poll was released Tuesday morning as the two-day MWC media conference kicked off at the Renaissance Hotel in Las Vegas, Nev.
The Mountain West’s coaches do not produce a preseason poll.
The Aztecs received 22 of 25 first place votes and a total of 272 points in the poll while the team they shared last season’s title with, Boise State, received two first place votes and 234 points. Fresno State, along with Preseason Player of the Year pick in senior guard Marvelle Harris, received the poll’s only other first-place vote, but was picked fifth overall with 182 points.
Utah State’s 190 points placed the Aggies third in the poll, followed by UNLV (185), Fresno State and the Lobos (164) at sixth. The rest of the poll played out with Colorado State (144), Wyoming (101), Nevada (97), Air Force (51) and San Jose State (30).
Harris was joined on the preseason All-MWC team by Boise State senior guard/forward Anthony Drmic, Boise State junior forward James Webb III, SDSU senior forward Winston Shepard and Wyoming senior guard Josh Adams.
UNLV’s star 7-foot freshman forward Stephen Zimmerman was tabbed preseason MWC Freshman of the Year.
2015-16 Mountain West Preseason Poll (place, team, first place votes in parenthesis, total points)
1. San Diego State (22) 272
2. Boise State (2) 234
3. Utah State 190
4. UNLV 185
5. Fresno State (1) 182
6. New Mexico 164
7. Colorado State 144
8. Wyoming 101
9. Nevada 97
10. Air Force 51
11. San Jose State 30
2015-16 All-MWC Preseason Team G Josh Adams, Sr., Wyoming
G Marvelle Harris, Sr., Fresno State
G/F Anthony Drmic, Sr., Boise State
F Winston Shepard, Sr., San Diego State
F James Webb III, Jr., Boise State
Player of the Year: Marvelle Harris, Sr., guard, Fresno State
Newcomer of the Year: Tim Williams, Jr., forward, New Mexico
Freshman of the Year: Stephen Zimmerman, F, UNLV
To view Journal staff writer Geoff Grammer’s preseason ballot, which was submitted Oct. 5, CLICK HERE . Also, you can follow his updates throughout the two-day conference via Twitter by following him @GeoffGrammer .
